result.execSummary:
The defendant Arthur A Bodanske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 24 days jail, consecutive, for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine.

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Arthur A Bodanske in court with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The Defendant was sentenced as follows:
FINE: $379.00 (to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/16 or serve 24 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment).
DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 (to be paid at $50.00 per month consecutive to payment on fine).

Defendant Arthur A Bodanske in court with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Babe advises the Court that the Defendant has 15 sessions to complete and is expected to finish mid June.   Attorney Babe to provide the Court with a treatment update in the future prior to sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Arthur A Bodanske in court with attorney Kathleen Lindgren for  Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.   The Court schedules the matter for a status date in 45 days to check the status of treatment program which is scheduled to last approximately 16 weeks.  Hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
